Families First Coronavirus Response Act - Leave Provisions

div.span: Governor Cooper issued an Executive order during a live-stream announcement March 23, 2020 at 9:00 am closing all NC Public Schools for in person instruction through May 15, 2020. Our leadership team has not finalized all details on how Clinton City Schools will operate following the announcement of this executive order. Please continue to visit this page for more details.

a.title: Link to CDC Guidelines

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Tahoma;

a.span: CDC: Interim Guidance: Get Your Household Ready for Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)

span.style: text-decoration-line: underline; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Tahoma; font-size: 18px;
span.a: NCDHHS: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Response in North Carolina

h1.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.1; margin: 1em 0px 0.5em; font-size: 30px;

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px 0px 1em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px; line-height: 1.6em; overflow-wrap: break-word;
p.span: According to the CDC, here’s how you can take precautions to keep yourself, your family, and your community healthy:

ul.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.88em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px;

li.span: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

ul.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.88em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px;

li.span: Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth.

ul.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.88em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px;

li.span: Stay home when you are sick.

ul.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.88em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px;

li.span: Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.

ul.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.88em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px;

li.span: Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces using a regular household cleaning spray or wipe.

ul.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.88em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px;

li.span: Follow CDC’s recommendations for using a facemask.

ul.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.88em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px;

li.span: CDC does not recommend that people who are well wear a facemask to protect themselves from respiratory diseases, including COVID-19.

ul.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.88em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px;

li.span: Facemasks should be used by people who show symptoms of COVID-19 to help prevent the spread of the disease to others. The use of facemasks is also crucial for health workers and people who are taking care of someone in close settings (at home or in a health care facility).

ul.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.88em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px;

li.span: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the bathroom; before eating; and after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing.

ul.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.88em; font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 18px;

li.span: If soap and water are not readily available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol. Always wash hands with soap and water if hands are visibly dirty.

div.span: Website by SchoolMessenger Presence. © 2020 Intrado Corporation. All rights reserved.
